channel.description: Girl with Curves is the personal style blog of Tanesha Awasthi, offering outfit inspiration, style and shopping advice.
channel.title: Girl with Curves

item.title: Curvy Confessions
item.description:
We all have those moments when we can do nothing but laugh about ourselves.  

These are just a few popular occurances that come up in my personal circle of curvies.

item.title: Peach
item.description:
Nothing warms up a Winter wardrobe like the color peach.

   

|WEARING| Zara Jacket, Forever 21 Blouse (similar here), Bangles from India, Michael Kors Bag, Jeans thanks to James Jeans,

Zigi Soho Sandals via DSW, MAC Lippy in ‘Ravishing’

As Winter fades and Spring emerges, I like to introduce a warmer color palette into my wardrobe.

This peach topper is quickly becoming my fave Spring staple!

item.title: Neon
item.description:
I never thought I’d embrace the neon trend…

|WEARING| Forever 21 Blouse, Skirt thanks to Asos, Belt via Target, Vintage Earrings, Bangles from India, BCBG Bag, Sam Edelman Pumps (similar here)

I never thought I’d embrace the neon trend, but what better way to conjure Spring, than with a bold shade of citron?!

item.title: Winged Eyeliner
item.description:
My everyday makeup is simple, quick and fuss-free, but sometimes I like a little more drama! For days when I want a little something extra, I add winged eyeliner.

Here’s how to get the look.

Tools:
Liquid Eyeliner or Eyeliner Pen
Q-Tip
Makeup Remover

1 of 5

item.title: Classic Neutrals
item.description:
|WEARING| United Colors of Benetton Jacket, Forever 21 Top, Vintage Bracelet, Michael Kors Bag, Old Navy Skinnies, Top Shop Flats (similar here)

As much as I love color, you can never go wrong with classic black and white.  Throw in hints of gold and an oversize jacket in a muted tone, and you’ve got a classically chic ensemble that never goes out of style.

item.title: Moto
item.description:
I’ve been in search of the perfect moto jacket for as long as I can remember.

  

|WEARING| Jacket thanks to Wilsons Leather (site-wide 30% off SALE happening now!), Wilfred Blouse, Foreign Exchange Clutch (similar here),

Old Navy Skinnies, Enzo Angiolini Pumps (similar here & here)

 

Ever since moto jackets emerged as a wardrobe staple a couple seasons ago, I’ve admired them from afar, thinking I could never pull off such a tough, edgy style.  But fashion isn’t about ignoring things you admire, just because you think they won’t work.  Sometimes, it’s about finding a way to make the trend work with your personal style- putting your own twist on a certain trend, and making it your own.

 

 
That said, I’ve been in search of the perfect leather moto jacket for as long as I can remember, so when Wilsons Leather asked if I wanted to choose one from their latest collection, I couldn’t resist the challenge!  A moto jacket isn’t typically something I’d classify as classic or girly (like the majority of my wardrobe), but when it’s black in color, with a hint of shine, has an asymmetrical zipper, adjustable waist tabs for a custom fit, an oversized collar, and looks good both open and closed, what more could a girl ask for?!  Paired with a ladylike blouse, ankle skinnies and pumps, I’m loving my feminine twist on this edgy trend.

item.title: Ten Things
Birthday Suit
item.description:
|WEARING| Forever 21 Blouse, Xhilaration Belt via Target, J. Crew Earrings, BCBG Bag, Dorothy Perkins Skirt, Nine West Heels (similar here & here)


My birthday isn’t something I usually celebrate…I tend to shy away from announcing I’m one year older, and find it hard to admit to myself I’m getting older.  This year though, I made a vow to embrace being one year wiser.  Instead of my usual moping around the house in pajamas, I celebrated in something that made me feel beautiful.

item.title: London Photo Diary
item.description: |ABOVE| Beg Ben | Wearing: Coat thanks to ModCloth, Faux Fur Infiniti Scarf thanks to Navabi, Zara Bag, Nine West Boots | Valentino Master of Couture Exhibit | Natural History Museum Architecture | Best Indo-Chinese Food | Ben’s Famous Cookies

item.title: Two Minute Eyebrows
item.description:
For many years, I struggled with sparse eyebrows. As a quick fix, I used to fill in my brows with pencils, until I graduated to a shadow and pencil blend, and eventually brow gel on top of anything else I could get my hands on. Recently though, I’ve developed a quick & easy way to fill in my brows, in less than 2 minutes!

|TOOLS| Disposable Mascara Wand, MAC Angled Brush, MAC Eye Shadow in ‘Brun,’ Anastasia Tinted Brow Gel in ‘Brunette’


Step 1: Tap Mascara Wand in shadow, and brush brows to separate hairs.

1 of 4

item.title: Playing Dress-Up
item.description:
I don’t think there’s anything more fun than playing dress-up in a designer showroom….

I’ve been in search of a bold colored pant suit for a while, so when I saw this hanging in Anna Scholz’s London showroom last week, I had to try it on!  

 

As for the printed dress below, it was Anna’s recommendation…she said I need to incorporate more prints into my wardrobe!

 

|OUTFIT 1| Suit borrowed from Anna Scholz’s Spring 2013 Collection, Forever 21 Blouse, BCBG Necklace, Nine West Booties, Michael Kors Bag

 

|OUTFIT 2| Dress borrowed from Anna Scholz’s Spring 2013 Collection, H&M Tights, Nine West Booties

 

 

Thanks for letting me play dress-up, Anna!

item.title: Closer Look
item.description:
Here’s a closer look at the outfit I wore for the meet & greet with Anna Scholz & Navabi.

|WEARING| Mossimo dress via Target, Forever 21 Blouse (similar here), BCBG Necklace, H&M Knit Tights (they carry size XL!),

Coat thanks to ModCloth (similar here), Nine West Booties via eBay (similar here), Michael Kors Bag

The weather in London calls for loads of layers, which doesn’t mean you can’t wear a dress and stay warm!

(And like a true Londoner, I’ve been wearing much more black than my usual, colorful wardrobe).

item.title: Meet & Greet
item.description:
A couple days ago I had the honor of meeting the Navabi Team, as well one of my curvy sheroes, designer Anna Scholz.

A couple days ago I had the honor of meeting the generous Navabi Team who so kindly brought me to London Fashion Week as part of the prize package for winning the Best Curvy Blog  2012 Award, as well as a meet & greet with one of my curvy sheroes, designer Anna Scholz.  

 

Here are some snaps from the morning, which consisted of lots of fashion chat, browsing Anna’s Spring & Fall 2013 Collections, and of course, me finding a way to get my hands on some of the clothes!  

 

 

  

 

Thank you so much to the Navabi Team who made my first trip to London one I’ll remember forever, and to Anna Scholz for taking the time to chat and letting me try on your amazing designs! (More outfit pics from that day coming soon!)

item.title: Layered in London
item.description:
Rarely do I get to dress for climates below 57 degrees fahrenheit…

 

|WEARING| Old Navy Coat, Forever 21 Sweater, H&M Faux Fur Stole, Old Navy Skinnies, Nine West Boots, J. Crew Earrings (similar here), Michael Kors Bag

Rarely do I get to dress for climates below 57 degrees Farenheit, so of course I took full advantage of the London chill, and layered a few

of my fave winter scores (including this Old Navy coat I thrifted for $8.99)!

item.title: Interview Ideas
item.description:
Time and time again, this infamous question shows up in my inbox: what should I wear on an interview?
When it comes to interviews, my style philosophy is to dress the part with
professionalism, sophistication, and a touch of personal style. 
Here are 3 interview outfit ideas, appropriate for the most common office dress codes: casual, business casual and corporate.  

First up is a casual look fit for a laid back environment, or intern position.
(Check out the next slide for a less casual ensemble that could also work for an intern interview or casual environment).

1 of 3

item.title: Blogiversary Giveaway
item.description:
To celebrate GWC turning 2, I’ve teamed-up with by boe to give away 2 accessory sets!

To celebrate GWC turning 2, I’ve teamed-up with by boe, one of my fave jewelry brands, to give away 2 accessory sets!  

 

I’m always on the hunt for timeless, everyday jewelry that works for the office as well as after hours, and the crystal studs I’m constantly sporting are my absolute faves!  As a way to say thanks for being loyal GWC readers, I’m giving away a pair of crystal nugget earrings, as well as the glass pave crystal tear drop version, and the most recent addition to my collection: a reminder bow ring. 

 

 

Here’s how to enter:

 

1) Comment below & explain what you’d wear the accessories with. 

2) Click here to ‘Like’ the by boe Facebook page.

3) Follow byboe on instagram (they share great accessorizing ideas!)

 

*Contest ends Wednesday 2/20 at midnight PST.

The winners will be chosen at random and announced on the GirlWithCurves facebook page on Thursday 2/21.

 

Thank you so much for following GirlWithCurves, I’m truly honored to have you as a reader!

item.title: Spin
item.description:
Nothing makes me happier than a coat with movement.

|WEARING| Coat thanks to Mod Cloth (similar here & here), Forever 21 Scarf (similar here), Seven Jeans (similar here), Nine West Flats, Michael Kors Bag

Nothing makes me happier than a coat with movement.

The pleating and vintage appeal, make fit & flare coats my absolute favorite outerwear.

(How could a girl resist taking a spin or two)?!

item.title: Collar Art
item.description:
The collared shirt is a timeless wardrobe staple, but how can this classics be modernized?

By adding a bit of art under the collar!

1 of 4

item.title: Utility Gone Glam
item.description:
I’m a fan of the utility jacket for its casual appeal.

 

|WEARING| Forever 21 Jacket (similar here & here in +) & Blouse, Vintage Earrings, BCBG Bag, Old Navy Jeans in ‘Batman’ wash,

Sam Edelman Pumps (similar here & here), MAC Lippy in ‘Love Lorn’

I’m a fan of the utility jacket for its casual appeal.

But adding a faux fur collar inspires a bit more sparkle and glam than utility usually does.

item.title: At The Office
item.description:
Office ensembles should be one part conservative and one part personal style.

  

|WEARING| Talbots Duster, Forever 21 Blouse (similar here & here), Vintage Earrings, BCBG Necklace (similar here), H&M Belt, Mod Cloth Skirt,

Zara Bag, Nine West Pumps (kitten heel version here)

Office ensembles should be one part conservative and one part personal style.

To me, that means adding elements of uniqueness (accessories and your own twist on trends), while keeping the look modest and office-appropriate.
